clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity and Safety Study of GSK Biologicals' Herpes Zoster Vaccine With Various Formulations in Adults >= 50 Years
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity and Safety Study of Different Formulations of GSK Biologicals' Herpes Zoster Vaccine 1437173A When Administered Twice in Adults Aged 50 Years and Older

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this randomized observer-blind trial is to further refine the formulation of vaccines containing GSK1437173A in older adults by comparing the cellular and humoral immune responses and the safety profiles of the different formulations.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of gE-specific Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4+) T-cells Expressing at Least 2 Different Immunological Activation Markers
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the second vaccination (Month 3)
primary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on CD4+ T-cells expressing at least 2 immunological activation markers among Interferon gamma (IFN-γ), Interleukin 2 (IL-2), Tumour Necrosis Factor alpha (TNF-α) and CD40 Ligand (CD40L). Frequencies were determined by in vitro Intracellular Cytokine Staining (ICS).

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Varicella-Zoster Virus (VZV)-Specific CD4+ T-cells Expressing at Least 2 Different Immunological Activation Markers
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the second vaccination (Month 3)
primary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on CD4+ T-cells expressing at least 2 immunological activation markers among Interferon gamma (IFN-γ), Interleukin 2 (IL-2), Tumour Necrosis Factor alpha (TNF-α) and CD40 Ligand (CD40L). Frequencies were determined by in vitro Intracellular Cytokine Staining (ICS).

primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the second vaccination (Month 3)
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations were determined by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the second vaccination (Month 3)
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations were determined by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 100 millimeters (mm) of injection site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6)post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, headache, myalgia and fever [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever higher than (>) 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the period after Month 8 up to the end of the study at Month 14
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any New Onset of Autoimmune Diseases (NOADs)
secondary_outcome.description: Any new onset of autoimmune diseases were to be reported throughout the entire study period, whether or not they were considered to be possibly related to the treatment administration. These included neurological/demyelinating events, rheumatic and connective diseases, autoimmune endocrine diseases, inflammatory bowel diseases, autoimmune blood disorders, inflammatory skin disorders, other autoimmune/inflammatory events, autoimmune bullous skin diseases, vasculitis and liver autoimmune diseases.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any New Onset of Autoimmune Diseases (NOADs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the period after Month 8 up to the end of the study at Month 14
secondary_outcome.description: Any new onset of autoimmune diseases were to be reported throughout the entire study period, whether or not they were considered to be possibly related to the treatment administration. These included neurological/demyelinating events, rheumatic and connective diseases, autoimmune endocrine diseases, inflammatory bowel diseases, autoimmune blood disorders, inflammatory skin disorders, other autoimmune/inflammatory events, autoimmune bullous skin diseases, vasculitis and liver autoimmune diseases.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Suspected Cases of Herpes Zoster (HZ)
secondary_outcome.description: A suspected case of HZ was defined as a rash consistent with HZ.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Suspected Cases of Herpes Zoster (HZ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the period after Month 8 up to the end of the study at Month 14
secondary_outcome.description: A suspected case of HZ is defined as a rash consistent with HZ.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Haematological and Biochemical Parameters Unknown, Below, Within or Above the Normal Ranges
secondary_outcome.description: Hematological and biochemical parameters assessed were Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST), Basophils (BAS), Calcium (CAL), Creatinine (CREA), Eosinophils (EOS), Fibrinogen (FIBR), Hematocrit (HCT), Hemoglobin (HGB), Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH), Lymphocytes (LYM), Mean Corpuscular Volume (MCV), Monocytes (MON), Neutrophils (NEU), Partial Thromboplastin Time (PTT), Platelets (PLAT), Prothrombin Time (PT), Red Blood Cells (RBC), Total Protein (TP) and White Blood Cells (WBC).

arm_group.description: Male or female subjects, 50 years of age or above, who received 2 doses of GSK1437173A (gE/ASO1B and gE/ASO1E) formulation 1 vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the upper deltoid region of the non-dominant arm on a 0, 2 month schedule.

Male or female subjects, 50 years of age or above, who received 2 doses of GSK1437173A (gE/ASO1B and gE/ASO1E) GSK1437173A formulation 2 vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the upper deltoid region of the non-dominant arm on a 0, 2 month schedule.

Male or female subjects, 50 years of age or above, who received 2 doses of GSK1437173A (gE/ASO1B and gE/ASO1E) formulation 3 vaccine, administered intramuscularly in the upper deltoid region of the non-dominant arm on a 0, 2 month schedule.

Male or female subjects, 50 years of age or above, who received 2 doses of saline solution (placebo), administered intramuscularly in the upper deltoid region of the non-dominant arm on a 0, 2 month schedule.

intervention.description: 2 vaccinations at Months 0 and 2 with GSK1437173A (different formulations)
2 vaccinations at Months 0 and 2 with placebo

outcome.time_frame: One month after the second vaccination (Month 3)
outcome.population: The analyses were performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) Cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects from Month 0 to 3. measure.title: Frequency of VZV-specific CD4+ T-cells Expressing at Least 2 Different Immunological Activation Markers
measure.description: The analysis focused on CD4+ T-cells expressing at least 2 immunological activation markers among Interferon gamma (IFN-γ), Interleukin 2 (IL-2), Tumour Necrosis Factor alpha (TNF-α) and CD40 Ligand (CD40L). Frequencies were determined by in vitro Intracellular Cytokine Staining (ICS).
measure.population: The analyses were performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) Cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects from Month 0 to 3. This included those subjects who met all eligibility criteria, complied with the protocol, with no elimination criteria during this part of the study and for whom immunogenicity measures were available.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 100 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analyses were performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented, who had their symptom sheets filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms.
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, headache, myalgia and fever [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever higher than (>) 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6)post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analyses were performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented, who had their symptom sheets filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
outcome.population: The analyses were performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any New Onset of Autoimmune Diseases (NOADs)
outcome.description: Any new onset of autoimmune diseases were to be reported throughout the entire study period, whether or not they were considered to be possibly related to the treatment administration. These included neurological/demyelinating events, rheumatic and connective diseases, autoimmune endocrine diseases, inflammatory bowel diseases, autoimmune blood disorders, inflammatory skin disorders, other autoimmune/inflammatory events, autoimmune bullous skin diseases, vasculitis and liver autoimmune diseases.
outcome.population: The analyses were performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
